clinical_study.brief_title: Supporting Attendance for Facility Delivery and Infant Health
clinical_study.official_title: Enhancing Retention in PMTCT/MNCH Services and Facility Delivery in Tabora, Tanzania

brief_summary.textblock: The goal of this proposed intervention study is to increase the proportion of HIV positive and HIV negative pregnant women who deliver in a facility, the proportion of HIV exposed infants (HEI) who receive nevirapine (NVP) within 48 hours of delivery, and the proportion of HEI who are bled for HIV polymerase chain reaction (PCR) deoxyribonucleic acid (DNA) testing within 8 weeks of age.

detailed_description.textblock: Following a formative phase I, we propose in phase II to implement a three-group cluster-randomized study to test the effectiveness of short message service (SMS) reminders and notifications, [mobile health or mhealth] (group 1) and the combined effectiveness of SMS reminders/notifications and cash transfers (group 2) compared to the standard prevention of mother-to-child transmission (of HIV)/maternal, neonatal and child health, (PMTCT/MNCH) practices (group 3).

primary_outcome.measure: Attendance for Early infant diagnosis (EID) of HIV
primary_outcome.description: Proportion of HIV-exposed infants (HEI) attending for early infant diagnosis of HIV (DBS collected) by 8 weeks

primary_outcome.measure: Early identification of HEI at Reproductive and Child Health (RCH) Clinic
primary_outcome.description: Proportion of HEI identified early (48 hours,3 and 7 days) at RCH clinic
Proportion of pregnant women attending at least 4 ANC visits
Proportion of pregnant women delivering in a health facility
Proportion of post partum women attending PNC 48 hours, 3 and 7 days post delivery
Proportion of HEI given NVP at delivery

secondary_outcome.description: Proportion of HEI who received EID results by 12 weeks

secondary_outcome.measure: HIV infected infants initiated on antiretroviral therapy (ART)
secondary_outcome.description: Proportion of HIV infected infants initiated on ART by 12 weeks of age
Time (days/weeks) from date of birth to attendance for EID

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to receipt of EID results
secondary_outcome.description: Time (days/weeks) from date of birth to receipt of EID results
Time (days/weeks) from date of birth to initiation of ART

arm_group.description: Clinics using SMS health promotion and reminder messages (mhealth messaging)
Clinics using SMS health promotion and reminder messages + Clinics providing payment scaled to reflect typical transport costs to facility (transport payments)
Services provided under the Ministry of Health standard care

intervention.description: SMS appointment reminders and health messaging via mobile phones
A payment scaled to reflect the cost of typical return transport fare for residents of the clinic catchment area

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Known or recently diagnosed HIV-positive in ANC or; Tested HIV-negative at ANC
- Plans to deliver in facility catchment area
- 18 years or older
- Able and willing to provide consent
Exclusion Criteria:
